definition: complicated and simple/traditional and simplified form of Chinese characters
complicated/many/in great numbers/abbr. for 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3], traditional form of Chinese characters
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: Tom Riddle would kill Lord Voldemort, and it would be the last thing he did.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆谜语将杀死繁简体转换，而这是最后的事情来做。

sentences.english: There are also comparisons between Simplified and Traditional characters, and many multimedia enhancements.
sentences.chinese: 其内有生字繁简对照，及多媒体补充教材。

sentences.english: He's venerating the room that Seymour and Buddy occupied.
sentences.chinese: 在对西莫和巴蒂住的繁简保佑崇敬之情。

sentences.english: The ten chapters explain multifarious contents but are contextual corresponding and structural complete.
sentences.chinese: 十章虽内容有别，繁简不同，然前后相应，密不可分。

sentences.english: Characters and Their Standardization in Hong Kong, …
sentences.chinese: 试论香港繁简字的运用及其规范。

definition: shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
variant of 筆畫|笔画[bi3 hua4]
to favor one and discriminate against the other (abbr. for 厚此薄彼[hou4 ci3 bo2 bi3])
the small or lesser seal, the form of Chinese character standardized by the Qin dynasty
the important and the less important/primary and secondary
